options.title: The Violet Heart
options.description: The grasslands' center. Purple so deep it hurts to look at. Nomad shrines circle it. Nothing grows here except questions.

options.title: First Purple
options.description: Where green grass becomes ultraviolet. The transition line is sharp, unnatural. You can stand with one foot in each world.

options.title: Llama Grave Markers
options.description: Bleached bones arranged in patterns. The locals bury their pack animals here. Or something buries them for the locals.

options.title: The Swaying Fields
options.description: Endless grass moving without wind. The motion makes you dizzy. Follow the sway or make your own path?

options.title: Wine-Stain Oasis
options.description: Water tastes of fermentation. Purple reeds grow thick as walls. You hear singing that might be wind, might be nomads, might be neither.

options.title: The Nomad Crossroads
options.description: Trade routes intersect. Wagon ruts in seven directions. Fresh tracks, but no caravans visible. They just left. Or they're just arriving.

options.title: Singing Pillars
options.description: Stone monoliths vibrate with subsonic frequencies. Your teeth ache. Something watches from the purple grass, or maybe the pillars are watching.

options.title: The Cardamom Road
options.description: The grass here smells of spice. Nomad camps every few miles, abandoned but warm. They're always one step ahead of you.

options.title: Purple Rain Territory
options.description: The sky weeps violet. The rain doesn't wet you, it stains. Everything here is dyed. Including you, eventually.

options.title: The Horizon Throne
options.description: A chair carved from single stone, facing the setting sun. Whoever sat here last never left‚Äîtheir silhouette burned into the rock.

options.title: Mare's Milk Station
options.description: Nomad waystation. Fermented milk in clay jars. Llama pens empty but recently used. A fire still burns. Where did everyone go?

options.title: The Color Fields
options.description: Grass cycles through every shade of purple: lavender, violet, indigo, shades that don't have names. Don't stare too long.

options.title: The Last Nomad Camp
options.description: Largest camp you've ever seen. Hundreds of tents, all abandoned. Food still warm. Tracks lead away in all directions at once.

options.title: The Crystal Markets
options.description: Where traders from every nation gather. Or gathered. Or will gather. Time is negotiable here, and so is everything else.

options.title: First Rainbow
options.description: Where the grasslands meet strange colors. Oil slicks on water, but in the sky. The air tastes sweet and wrong.

options.title: Caravan Bones
options.description: Wagon wheels half-buried in sand. Trade goods scattered, worthless now. No bodies‚Äîjust empty clothes, neatly folded.

options.title: The Amber Road
options.description: Path paved with fossilized resin. Insects and small creatures trapped inside, still moving. The road hums when you walk on it.

options.title: Spice Graveyard
options.description: Sacks of pepper, saffron, cardamom left to rot. The smell is overwhelming. No one takes them. Why?

options.title: The Counting Station
options.description: Trade post where all goods are weighed, measured, counted three times. The scales work, but the numbers never match.

options.title: Porcelain Market
options.description: Stalls abandoned but goods remain: pottery, spices, silk. Too neat. Too preserved. Someone maintains this. You never see them.

options.title: Rainbow-Oil Springs
options.description: Iridescent liquid bubbles from the ground. It reflects your face wrong. Smells like burnt sugar and ozone. Don't drink it.

options.title: The Silk Crossroads
options.description: Fabric banners from a hundred nations. Some nations don't exist anymore. The wind makes them whisper prices.

options.title: Mirror-Glass Crossing
options.description: The ground reflects sky so perfectly you can't tell up from down. Walk carefully or fall into yourself.

options.title: The Jeweler's Rest
options.description: Gemstones scattered like gravel. Real ones mixed with glass. You could spend days sorting them. Some people have. Some people still are.

options.title: The Counting House
options.description: Stone building, door ajar. Inside: ledgers spanning centuries. All debts unpaid. All accounts unbalanced. Your name is already in one.

options.title: Color-Drunk Square
options.description: Former marketplace. The colors here are impossible: hues between hues, shades that hurt. Traders went mad trying to name them.

options.title: The Black Gate
options.description: First sight of it: obsidian walls that drink light. The gate is open. Has been for centuries. Will you enter?

options.title: First Rubble
options.description: Where the grasslands meet broken stone. Recent ruins or ancient? You can't tell. Both, maybe. Time works differently here.

options.title: The Fallen Tower
options.description: It fell centuries ago but is still falling. You can watch it collapse in slow motion. Don't stand underneath.

options.title: Collapsed Archive
options.description: Papers everywhere, languages you don't know. The wind turns pages. Something important was recorded here. Past tense.

options.title: The Empty District
options.description: Buildings intact but hollow. No furniture, no people, no signs of life. Just architecture, perfectly preserved, perfectly useless.

options.title: Machine Garden
options.description: Rusted mechanisms grow like trees. Copper vines, iron flowers. Some pieces still move when you're not looking.

options.title: The Broken Plaza
options.description: Once grand, now cracked. Water pools in stone that shouldn't hold water. Reflections show a different plaza, intact.

options.title: Ghost Road
options.description: Paved street leading to nothing. You see afterimages of people walking it. They don't see you. They're stuck in their moment.

options.title: The Clockwork Ruins
options.description: Gears larger than houses, stopped mid-turn. The whole city was a machine. No one remembers what it did.

options.title: Porcelain District
options.description: Every building made of fired clay. Nobles frozen in ceramic, their painted eyes following you. Some are warm to the touch.

options.title: Fragment Quarter
options.description: Buildings half-phased into reality. You see three eras at once. Don't touch the walls‚Äîthey'll pull you into the wrong time.

options.title: The Archive Engine
options.description: Massive machine that recorded everything. Still running. Still recording. It's documenting your presence right now.

options.title: The Final Factory
options.description: Where they made the things that ended the world. Assembly lines frozen mid-production. The last widget sits incomplete.

options.title: The First Stair
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: Or the last, depending on direction. Descending takes you deeper into earth. Ascending takes you further from reality. Choose.

options.title: Step One
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: A single stair, descending into earth. You could follow it. Each step down takes you further from the surface world.

options.title: The Counting Stone
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: Boulder carved with numbers: 1 through 847,293, then it stops. Blood on the chisel. Someone gave up. Or finished.

options.title: Reality Thin
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: The air shimmers. You can almost see through to somewhere else‚Äîa city? A desert? Gone before you can focus. Boundaries are negotiable here.

options.title: The Numbers Field
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: Grass carved with equations. The math doesn't work in any system you know. It works in a system you're about to learn.

options.title: Staircase Fragment
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: Steps going nowhere, carved with obsessive counting. The numbers skip. 744, 745, 746, 751. What happened to 747-750?

options.title: The Echo Plains
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: Your voice returns different. Sometimes in languages you don't speak. Sometimes before you've spoken.

options.title: Counting Fields
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: Numbers carved into every surface. Pilgrims spent lifetimes here, seeking the final digit. None have found it. Some are still looking.

options.title: The Distortion
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: Distance lies here. That hill is either a mile away or ten feet. The only way to know is to walk it. The answer changes each time.

options.title: Color Storm Territory
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: The sky cycles through impossible hues. Your shadow doesn't match your body. Time moves sideways. Stay too long and you'll be yesterday.

options.title: The Cult's Rest
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: Where stair-counters sleep. They dream of numbers. You can hear them counting in their sleep. They're all on different counts.

options.title: The Maze Stairs
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: They branch. They merge. They loop. Cultists map them obsessively. No two maps agree. All maps are correct.

options.title: The Last Stair
options.terreno: ‚ô† The Long Long Stairs & Weird Zones
options.description: Where the stairs finally end‚Äîor begin. Cultists gather here. They've been counting. The final number is different every time.

options.title: THE BLACK CITY
options.description: Towers of obsidian glass that drink light. Streets that lead everywhere and nowhere. You've arrived. The gate is open. It's always been open. What do you do now?
